title: What part of speech is the word “removed”? - Quora

response.answer_text: The word “removed” is past and past participle of the verb “remove”. Meaning: 1) take (something) away or off from the position occupied. Example: Customs officials removed documents from the premises. Meaning: 2) abolish or get rid of. Example: Exchange controls have finally been removed.

It may be either the Past Simple or the Past Participle of the verb “to remove”. Past Simple: She hurried into the house and removed her wet shoes. Past Participle: I have removed the out-of-date files from your desk.
